page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO PLUMPTON
page.content: Plumpton Green is a smallish village situated about six and a half miles north _ west of Lewes,six miles from Burgess Hill and Haywards Heath.It has two general stores,one church,two pubs,and a butcher's shop. Today Plumpton Green's population is nearly one thousand people.The growth of the village was originally due to the arrival of the railway in late Victorian times,when the station and many of the older houses were built.This led to a new church,All Saints,to be built for the increasing community.Since there is little employment in the village itself,most of the people leave for London or nearby towns for work each day;but this travel is usually by car,and the railway station is not greatly used,except on race days.All that exists of the original" green" of
